intro: Eriogonum molle, commonly known as softleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriogonum molle is often used in native plant landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
